commitment_txt: Protection of Human Rights and Fundamental Freedoms in the online environment
Promote online safety and combat violence online
Protect human rights and the principles of the rule of law including effective remedies
Oppose abuse of Internet or algorithms for unlawful surveillance or oppression
Reduce illegal and harmful content and activities online while promoting the right to freedom of expression
Promote affordable, inclusive, and reliable access to the Internet for everyone
Protect and strengthen the multi-stakeholder system of Internet governance (i.e., United Nations, World Trade Organisation, G7, G20, etc.)
Promote cooperation in research and innovation on security threats and responsible state behavior in cyberspace
Foster greater exposure to diverse cultural and multilingual content and bolster resilience to disinformation and misinformation
Support digital literacy skills
Protect the technical infrastructure essential to the general availability and integrity of the Internet
Refrain from government-imposed Internet shutdowns or degradation of Internet access to lawful content and services
Base government access to personal data according to existing laws and respecting human rights
Refrain from using the Internet to undermine voting systems, elections, and political processes
Work together to combat cybercrime and deter malicious cyber activity
Promote and use trustworthy network infrastructure and service suppliers
Promote online protection of consumers, in particular vulnerable consumers
Maximize the enabling effects of technology for combating climate change and protecting the environment
Protect individualsâ€™ privacy and their personal data
Support a rules-based global digital economy fostering fair online markets
Promote the benefits of data flows based on shared values and trust
Inclusive and affordable access to the Internet
